section.title: Scope
section.para: The &fedc; main focus is to provide sites a way to control and mange cloud enviroments for scientific computing.

With such a diversity of cloud solutions all under going very active development it is impossible for a group such as &fedc; to only support a single cloud implementation, as we would not be serving the needs of the &hepix; site community.

One of the side effects of &egi; having pioneered Grid computing, is that the community have already learned about the diversity of sites, and considerable effort has been put into minimising the differences between sites from a experiments perspective. The &hep; community and sites serving them have come to understand that some areas of site management are not practical to unify. In areas where tools and practices are developing quickly innovation is potentially hindered by enforcing standardisation. This is also true that site management requires considerable effort which has already been invested, and change would be detrimental, a good example of this is in site deployment and configuration. The &fedc; decided very early on that we where not going to look into areas that would effect sites local deployment and configuration. The rational was that many sites already had virtualisation strategies, and sites that did not, should not be prevented from working with newer tools and cloud infrastructures.

section.title: &fedc; Scope
section.para: From these basic use cases the &fedc; decided to focuses on four main areas of investigation.

itemizedlist.listitem: A recipe to make site neutral ∨.
A mechanism to distribute ∨ consistent with the requirements and use cases of &hepix; sites.
A mechanism to make site neutral ∨ interact with the site batch queue.

section.para: These four areas of investigation have led to the sections which make up the remainder of this document.
